update.description:
Related to issue [1363](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1363/add-measurement-units-to-inspector).   
This pull request fixes measurement unit for inspector windows in Building Editor:   
1. Add measurement unit `m` for `length`, `height`, `thickness`.     
2. Align numbers to the right 
3. Reorder the `lengthLabel` to be in place with the order in the inspector.  
4. Remove the comment `Distance from Start to End point`.   
5. Change the `length` property from  `QGroupBox`  to `QGridLayout`.   
6. Add a dummy label to both `color` and `texture` field for alignment purpose.
update.title: Add measurement unit to inspectors for Building Editor

content.raw: This looks good to me! I made a couple of changes which this pull request reminded me of on branch [issue_1363_louise](#!/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/issue_1363_louise%0Dissue_1363#diff), feel free to merge it in with this pull request if you agree with the changes. It's just about adding `this->` to member variables and improving some ranges as we discussed the other day.
content.html: This looks good to me! I made a couple of changes which this pull request reminded me of on branch issue_1363_louise, feel free to merge it in with this pull request if you agree with the changes. It's just about adding this-> to member variables and improving some ranges as we discussed the other day.

content.raw: I think here since everything is on the same line, you could use a `QHBoxLayout` instead of a `QGridLayout`, then you don't need the indices when adding widgets.

~~Could you just remove the `lengthCaptionLabel` but leave the spin box and the rest (and add unit to it)? ~~

Could you just remove the lengthCaptionLabel but leave the spin box and the rest (and add unit to it)? It's useful for the users to change the size of the wall directly without needing to think about the start/end points.

Sorry, I just saw you moved the code below
